uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.html

Class HTMLForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.BaseForm
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.MapForm
        • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.html.BaseHTMLForm
          • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.html.HTMLForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Field>, Contexed, Form

    public class HTMLForm
extends BaseHTMLForm
    HTMLForm is a class representing a form in HTML This type of form is for the MVC pattern where the form page is seperate from the processing Servlet. If an error occurs then the info is stored in the request and the posting page is invoked.
    Author:
    spb

      • getHtmlFieldTable

        public <X extends HtmlBuilder> X getHtmlFieldTable(X result)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        HtmlPrinter form fragment

      • getHtmlFieldTable

        public java.lang.String getHtmlFieldTable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        emit the HTML edit form based on the current request if there are no current errors then the internal form state is shown but unvalidated (assume these are the default values of a creation form). For an update form where the initial state should be validated use #getHtmlFieldTable(HtmlPrinter) if there are no errors in the request
        Parameters:
        req - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        String HTML fragment contain the HTML form

      • getHtmlFieldTableFromRequest

                                            boolean use_required)

For an update form where the initial state should be validated use #getHtmlFieldTable(HtmlPrinter) if there are no errors in the request
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        HtmlPrinter

      • doFormError

        public static void doFormError(AppContext ctx,
               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
        redirect to the submitting form if errors occur in the form We expect the URL of the submitting form to be avaliable as a "form_url" parameter.from the form. This avoid the Servlets needing to know which form submitted to them and keeps presentation and logic seperate. The actuall error information is cached in the request object by the Form Code
        Parameters:
        ctx - AppContext
        req - Request
        res - Response

      • getErrors

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getErrors(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

      • getFormURL

        public static java.lang.String getFormURL(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Get the url to use for error reporting. If it already exists in the parameters then use that (we have already returned errors). Otherwise assume this is the first show of the form and take it from the request.
        Parameters:
        req -
        Returns:
        String

      • getGeneralError

        public static java.lang.String getGeneralError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
